meanings.definition: The top or highest part of something.
meanings.sent1: The upperpart of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: She placed the book on the upperpart of the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel climbed to the upperpart of the tree and chattered away.
meanings.sent4: His dreams reached the upperpart of the sky, soaring high.
meanings.sent5: The upperpart of the waterfall sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The section of a garment that covers the upper part of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her dress had intricate lace on the upperpart.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the collar on the upperpart of his shirt.
meanings.sent3: The cat got tangled in the upperpart of the curtain and meowed for help.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a queen in the upperpart of her elegant gown.
meanings.sent5: The upperpart of the jacket kept her warm in the chilly breeze.

meanings.definition: The upper portion of a structure or object.
meanings.sent1: The upperpart of the building housed the executive offices.
meanings.sent2: He painted the upperpart of the fence a bright red.
meanings.sent3: The upperpart of the cake was decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The upperpart of the tree swayed gently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The upperpart of the bridge offered a stunning view of the river below.
